frameDefinitions: An Assailant attacks a Victim, intending to die in the process.
A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.
An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
The words in this frame describe acts (or situations characterized by acts) that cause injury or harm.

The words in this frame describe situations in which the Perpetrator has sexual intercourse with the Victim forcibly (or by threatening the use of force) and without his or her consent. '' 'Does the press make it more difficult for raped women to obtain justice?'
frameExamples: The terrorist <t>suicide attack</t> on U.S. troops early last week caused more damage than initially reported.
As soon as he stepped out of the bar he was <t>set</t> upon by four men in ski-masks.
Research on whether concealed carry laws increase gun <t>violence</t> among gang members has been inconclusive.
Does the press make it more difficult for <t>raped</t> women to obtain justice?
listRoleDefinitions: This <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s suicide attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
This role is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The <fen>Aggressor</fen> is the person causing the <fen>Victim</fen>'s injury.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured.
The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the <fen>Victim</fen>
The <fen>Aggressors</fen> commit acts of violence upon each other.
<fen>Time</fen> identifies the time when the harm-causing event occurs.
<fen>Place</fen> identifies the place where the violence occurs.
This is the person who forces another person to have sexual intercourse with him or her against the other person's will.
This is the person who is forced to engage in sexual intercourse against his or her will.
The rape of a <fen>Victim</fen> by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: Her suicide attack <fex>on the guardsmen</fex> was the third such attack in the last month.
<fex>The group's</fex> suicide attacks continue to affect troop morale.
<fex>Last Tuesday's</fex> suicide attack killed seven and wounded 20.
Last week's suicide bombing <fex>outside the city</fex> was the first in weeks.
<fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.
The mysterious fighter attacked <fex>the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.
<fex>The mysterious fighter</fex> attacked the guardsmen with a sabre.
<fex>As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> he was set upon by four men in ski-masks.
Then Jon-O's forces ambushed them <fex>on the left flank</fex> from a line of low hills.
<fex>Your</fex> brutality on your enemies seems to know no boundaries.
Increasing violence against supporters of government reform have attracted international attention.
<fex>The storm's</fex> violence left many lives in shambles.
Hope for a peaceful resoliton is gone as violence <fex>between the two sides</fex> reignites.
<fex>Last week's</fex> violence resulted in over three hundred injuries.
City leaders are troubled by recent surges in <fex>local</fex> violence
The lawyer said the woman was raped <fex>on a night of madness</fex>
